Like to end the evening with these fruit beers, but still too sweet. Raspberry taste is everywhere and kills all other.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

30 cl bottle. Pink color and hazy, foam is pink and nice. Taste and aroma is like rasberry cheescake lippalm. Really artificial taste. A bit bitter, but ends really sweetly. At the end it made me bit sick.
Pink colour, nice foam. Strong artifial taste an smell. Not a plesant beer. Taste once and not again. The taste and smell of fake fruits kills any good witbeer taste.
This seems to be a wit bier flavoured with raspberries, I found it refreshing and easily drinkable, rasberries dominated the flavour, but overall quite nice
This hoegaarden has little aroma and pours pink with a little head. It has a sweet texture that lingers.
270112: Unclear pink fruit beer with a light beige foam. The scent is sweet with notes of raspberry and marzipan. Sweet candy-like creamy raspberry taste.
Bottle from Belgisk Bryg. Pink colour with a reddish head. Aroma and flavour of cherry and sugar.

Bottled.  A reddy pink coloured beer with a whitish head.  All that’s bad about Belgian fruit beers here but still fun enough to drink.  Sweet artificial cherries in a wheaty background.  Syrupy, sweet and poppy.  A bit like cherry drinks.  So false yet so easy to drink in guzzlable quantities.

Finalmente qualcuno ha preso questa "birra" così ho potuto assaggiarla e ora la voto. Non c’è moltissimo da dire: base blanche, sciroppo di lamponi. Buona parte delle "framboise" dolci del mondo è fatta così, su base hoegaarden lo sciroppo trionfa in maniera particolare; e chi la beve ancora gli piace. Beato lui
Dai sinceramente un pò meglio della versione al limone, ma anche questa la potevano risparmiare...
Dost nechuntý radler, sladký jako cecek. Holkám ale asi chutnat může, já však už nikdy více.
4.5% cloudy pink with a good head, sweet raspberry aroma and taste, not a beer for me,

Pours a hazy pink with little head that evaporates quickly. Strong rasberry smell and only slight hint of the wheat. Taste is fairly sweet with only a little sourness. Easy drinking with little carbonation, but a slight fizzyness that keeps it drinkable. Quick finish. Was drunk as eating vanilla ice and it fits it surprisingly well.
Aaand another recovered rate from Leuven! Murky red body, pinkish head. Sickly fruity nose, crap... Sweet raspberry taste, with something light that starts with "arb". Eh? Another one to be rerated.

Corked 750ml bottle from Waitrose. A mostly inoffensive fruity wheat beer. Pinkish. Some foam. Dryish. Some tin. Not too sweet. Sometimes there’s an ugly aspartame flavour, but mostly it’s an easy drinking beer.

Bottle @ home. Cloudy peach appearance with an off white head. Strong raspberry syrup, light wheat malty nose. Well carbonated, slightly syrupy mouth feel. Very sweet, lightly tart raspberry, strawberry, slightly tangy, very sweet flavor. This sucker is very sweet and one dimensional. Actually very disappointing.
Pours hazy red with a medium pink head. Aroma is malts and strawberries. Flavor is much of the same. Drinkable.

Bottle 250ml @ The Square, København

Pours slightly hazy amber to orange with a pink head. Aroma has notes of raspberries. Taste is medium sweet. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

I normally do not rate these crappy beer mixes but in a social sitting you must. 250 ml can at a party in Germany. Don’t know what it looked like in the can but better that I did not see it. Awful aroma, fake raspberry fresh urine. Flavor is fake raspberry, sweet but has a weird, bitter finish. Crap, should not even be on Ratebeer.
3% 75cl bottle from Tesco - tastes like mildly alcoholic Slush Puppy - way too sweet and no fruit character, just the blue raspeberry taste...
75cl bottle from Tesco. It was 3% not 4.5%. Tasted resoundingly of raspberries. Quite refreshing in a soft drink kind of way. Tangy with just a hint of original Hoegaarden about it. Not great.

250 ml. bottle. A fruit beer made not with lambic, but with white beer.Pink salmon thick head, with a pinksih foam that doesn´t hold much. Smell of raspberries, with a hint of corainder and spices. Too sugary in the palate, though one can feel some sourness, taste is esentially raspberry. I can’t say I find it interesting, give the real Hoegaarden anyday.
Bottle, pours a nice hazy red. it had a good smell of sweet fruits and yeasty notes. it was actually quite complex and enjoyable. Little bit too sweet for me to drink often. but it was enjoyable
Bottle. Poures light pink with little head. Mostly fruity aromas and similar yeasty flavours to hoegaarden.

Thanks to fata2683 for this one in trade.  Interesting what they did with this one.  Pours a hazy yellow-brown with a small white head.  Nose is raspberries and table sugar with subtle hints of bread and wheat.  Flavor is sugary raspberry puree.  Yep.  Finish is some raspberries and sugar.  Not much more to it.  Interesting.
Fruity aroma and raspberry flavors with vaguely tangy yeast notes. Fully drinkable soda, not beer! But it’s the best Fruit Beer, I tasted so far.
Bottle from ASDA. Pours a dark pink colour with a thin white head. Aroma is fruity with hints of raspberry, the taste is sweet and a bit watery but finishes with a dry raspberry taste.

Not my cup of tea.  So bad, in fact, my wife liked it - and she hates beer!  Incredibly fruity (as you’d expect), very floral.  Described by a friend as being just like Creamola Foam.  An insult to Creamola Foam.

Bottle. Reddish – pink, hazy, small and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate, sugary sweet – artificial sweetness, berries. Body is light to medium, sugary sweet – artificial sweetness, berries. Finish is short, sugary sweet, (artificial) berries. Beer?
Nice taste but very sweet just bit to sweet for me. But looks smells and tastes good

Die Flasche mit ihrem schlichtem Etikett und einer einzelnen Himbeere gefällt mir gut. Trüb-rötliche Farbe des Bieres. Etwas rostfarben anmutend. 
Im Geruch sehr intensiv nach Natur-Himbeere vom Strauch. Im Antrunk süß-himbeerig, dominant. Ab dem Mittelteil kommt das gewürzte Witbier zum Vorschein, was aber noch etwas stärker hätte ausfallen sollen. 
Gar nicht mal übel, diese Kreation von Hoegaarden. Allerdings leidet die Süffigkeit etwas unter der schweren Süße.Test vom 2.9.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche
Little bit cloudy, grapefruit-like pink color. Smell is medium sweet, taste is too sweet for my liking. Light body, low carbo.

This is a lovely summer beer. If you hate fruity tastes this is not for you. I had this from a fridge on a summer evening. Masses of raspberries and mild hops. Lovely cloudy pink colour. Very smooth and not tart at all. One for the sweet tooths.

Der künstlich fruchtige Antrunk wird bei diesem Bier schnell durch eine chemische Süße verdrängt. Dadurch gerät die eigentliche Fruchtigkeit schnell in den Hintergrund, auch frisch wirkt das Bier nicht mehr wirkllich. 	 
Test vom 22.9.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 11,5,4,4,10,4 - 5,15
Pink colour with a short-lasting white head. Sweetish aroma of raspberries. The flavour is sugary sweet with loads of ripe raspberries. Good summer beer.

75 cl bottle, ASDA, Sheffield, UK. Hazy cranberry colour, foamy off-pink head. Sweet berry aroma, bright with an almost hidden funky yeast smell. Sweet flavour, too sweet, thick and straightforward artificial cherry finish.

(bottle courtesy of Fata2683!!).  Pours a cloudy apricot color with off-white head. Aroma is loaded with tart raspberries, hard candy and some wheat.  Taste is sweet from the raspberry and malts.  Thin bodied with a smooth fruity finish.  I know its not cool to like this but I think this is a super-easy drinking beer and it tastes great.  Heaven forbid a fruit beer is ranked highly.

Can at home in London. Pours a cloudy, grapefruit pink with a light film. Some seething raspberry peeking through the aroma, slightly stinging. Kind of an awkward flavor, light to medium sweet, with sharp fruits, some mild earth bitterness. Light bodied with fill-your-mouth, effervescent carbonation. Lightly sugary on the finish, some calmer fruit notes, subtle bitterness. Not as bad as the aroma would have you believe, but there’s nothing sensual about this beverage.

Bottle (750ml): Raspberry smelling with hints of strawberries too although neither is particularly strong. Some spices in there too.   Strawberry pink in colour, with a small, pink head that has good retention.   Raspberry tasting & really quiet nice going by the initial sip at least until it becomes sickening, some strawberry too and finishes with a tiny bit of bitterness.   Light bodied and containing a little fizz thanks to the high carbonation.    This one is very nice to begin with although ends up tasting like a sugary syrup after a while, thus becoming quite sickening in such a large bottle. - - - - www.abarwithnoname.wordpress.com

375ml bottle. Rating #202. Medium orange/pink color with a light pink head. Fruity berry aroma with a bit of nail polish as well, kinda weird. Flavor isn’t too bad though, sweet and light, lots of berry, more like a fruit juice, very mild. Thanks to data for the bottle. (1685)
june 2010, bottle. faint raspberry aroma. darker than pink but not quite red. first taste and i’m unimpressed. thin/med body, slightly syrupy. really sweet, probably syrup added. disappointing.
Bottle. Reddish, off white head with a touch of red. Aroma is sweet with fruit and malt dominating. Sweet fruity and malty flavour. Not my thing.

Unclear light red with a pink head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty and dominated by raspberry. Flavor is quite sweet and light acidic. Light acidic and sweet finish. The acidity provides some form af balance but it isn’t enough. 140608

On tap into a Hoegaarden tulip in Brugge...Pours a dirty pink with the faintest pink head...The aroma is faint raspberries, but generic and boring...The taste is very sweet, generic candied raspberries, easy to drink but to sweet for me.

A crappy generic sweet, typical marco stuff.

25 cl bottle courtesy of fata2683 - Pours a clear amber color with a 1/2 finger thick white head.  Very light lacing.  Aroma is toasted malt and berries.  Flavor is strong berries.  Medium body.  A decent fruit beer.  Thanks Keith.

don’t remember enjoying it as much as the written score but whatever, ordered for my mother and drank some for a rating .. . pours a tan mud caramel with pink tinge .. . light lacing with medium head ring .. . light pleasing red sugar aroma, hummingbird food .. . nice stuff, pretty simple and a tad sweeter than i expected but a nice base .. i could drain one or two but thats it .. . you lost alot of blood but we found most of it ..
It’s amazing what you’ll try simply because there is nothing else in the bar that you haven’t tried already. Luckily I’ll never have to try this one again.

Bottle via trade from fata2683. Somehow I had managed to go through almost a half dozen trades with Keith before I got Rosee’d. Thanks, I think... Pours muddy pink/orange, almost the colour (and clarity) of unfiltered red grapefruit juice. Nose is intensely sweet raspberries, very nice raspberry smell, but little else. Flavours are AARRRGGGH! Gah! It’s the most sugary thing I’ve ever drank, and I once drank a big jug of sugar water (someone told me it would get me high... lousy lying eighth graders). More raspberries here, where is the Hoegaarden? More a malt cooler than a beer. Avoid.

25 cl bottle from a beer retailer in Barcelona. It pours a light amber-pink liquid with light pink medium foam. Some lacing. The aroma is nice: intense raspberries, fresh wheat and yeast (there’s a Hoegaarden there!). The taste is pretty much the same, with the distant reminder that you’re actually drinking a Hoegaarden with concentrated juice. High sweetness, some acidity and almost no bitterness. Smart palate for a fruit beer. Nice fruity aftertaste. Very refreshing; perfect for hot sunny days and for people who does not drink beer regularly. The presentation (bottle and crown cap) is very nice and explicit.

Bottle 25cl @Auchan. Smell is nice and very intense on raspberries. Aroma is sweet, only fruity, not really bad a bit better than expected. The only thing is that bad aspartame sugar that remains in the mouse very long after finish and which I don’t like at all.

Pretty decent.  Nice for a raspberry beer.  A little chemical in the taste and palates, aftertaste.  Seems as though they added a concentrated Razz liquer to the beer.  If it were more natural I would rate it higher. Overall refreshing and nice, but needs some work.

Bottle. Pours pink grapefruit. Nose has some raspberry, but is mostly dietary sugar, saccharin, wheat and light coriander spice. Taste is mostly saccharin and dietary sugars. Hint of raspberry and wheat. Lightish body.
on tap.  poured a reddish yellow.  it didnt taste like fresh raspberries.  kind of a let down.  drinkable but the original is better.

bottle poured a pink golden in color with a thin covering of white foam. aroma has loads of raspberry, tons of sweetness, wheat, and a bit of yeast. mouth feel has a sugary coating and low carbonation. flavor really blasts out the berry and sweetness. I just don’t know this is so one directional and borders on being a soda pop just without the carbonation.
Bottled, somewhere in Amsterdam. Pink color with white head. Aroma, raspberry with hints of yeast. Taste pretty the same. Drinkable, refreshing beer for hot evenings in summer.

25cl bottle courtesy of fata. Thanks. Pours a muddy pinkish amber color with a small pink head that soon recedes to a fine film. The aroma is strong with raspberries. The flavor, like the aroma, has plenty of raspberries, tart fizzy candies and a bit of sour grapes. The palate is light with overly fizzy carbonation. Finishes long with sweet tarts. Overall: Nice nose, but this just doesn’t hold up.

Serving: 25 cl. bottle from fata2683.  Thanks Keith! 

Aroma: The nose is a mix of yeast, dirt, fake raspberries, and an odd solvent note. 

Appearance: This should be poured into a metal cup because it looks uglier than your aunt’s wart covered ass.  It pours a dirty, brownish red with black bits settling in the bottom.  The head is off-white and foamy but short lived. 

Taste: Sickenly sweet with lots of fake raspberry, a slight medicinal note, and some dirt.  Dreadful. 

Palate: Medium bodied with lots of prickly carbonation and a sweet, fake raspberry finish that lasts way to long. 

Overall: WHY KEITH!!! WHY!?!?!?
Awful aroma – fake raspberry and electrical fire.  Flavor is not quite cloyingly sweet but has a weird, bitter finish.  Lousy.

Ik vind deze persoonlijk wel heel erg zoet. Lekker misschien om met een paar dames op het terras te drinken, maar ook dan kun je beter een kriek of iets dergelijks nemen. Mijn vrouw (die geen bier lust) vind deze zelfs te zoet!

(bottle)  hazy pink with large pink head; aroma of sweetness and fruit; flavour also sweet and fruity, with nasty artificial aftertaste like diet soda; any beer with artificial sweetener is plain disgusting

Tap @ Olutravintola Malja. Rated @ 28.5.2009.

Served in a ice cold Hoegaarden glass. Poured a pink colour with a very frothy head, probably because of the cold glass. Sweet raspberry on the nose. Flavour of raspberries and mild sourness. Light bodied with a watery finish. This one is for the masses I guess.

Bottle:
Big white (slight hint of rose) quick disappearing foamy head.
Clear rose color.
Smell cherries, malts, sweets and hint of cleaner.
Taste is very sweet (though kriek sweetness is more pure), light wine a like, bit sour and bitter.
Hints of malts, yeast and sugars.
Not too well balanced specially in taste. Not my kind of beer.

(Can) Cloudy pinkish orange colour with frothy white head. Fruity nose with slightly sourish notes of wheat, fresh raspberries, hints of citrus and some balsamic vinegar. Sweet fruity taste, mainly with raspberries and hints of bready wheat and a touch of lime. Medium body, far too sweet. Would probably work as some kind of fruity, summer aperitif, but in beer terms it’s just weird. Drinkable but kind of pointless.
Can. Pours pinkish with a thin white head. Light fruity, light wheaty aroma. The flavor has a light raspberry light fruity sweetness on a wheaty base.

Bottle, BB 8/30/09.  Poured clear peachy-golden with a pink-tinted beige head.  The aroma picked up gritty and grainy raspberry seeds over a tart, wheat-inspired base.. fresh and well-balanced, but perhaps a touch watery.  The flavor found tart raspberry and lemon zest throughout, with a dry pale and wheaty base.. refreshing, but again too watery.. tart raspberry seeds on the moderately-long finish.  Lighter-bodied and nicely tangy on the palate.. decent feel, but it could’ve used a slightly bigger malt bill.
Bottle from Rai Wines. Nice colour and froth. Flavour is soft and rather weak. I’m getting some berries and the underlying Hoeg, but this is not really up to the job.

Re-rate 9.25 years later, this time a bottle found in Larnaca, Cyprus - medium muddy reddish brown body and okay foam, sweet cherry on the nose and a hint of malt. Flavour is more cloying cherry and malt trying to work together but kind of failing. Okay mouthfeel. Fake and disjointed.

First rating, June 18 2010 - Found in Paris, Montmartre. Intrigued by this - would it be a horrible idea to mess with a great wheat beer? Pours light pink with nice head into a flute glass. Aroma is sweet cherry and raspberry. Taste is a soft subdued mix of raspberry, far less sugary than I expected. Medium-dry finish. In fact, quite nice. 6 4 7 3 12

head: almost none 

coour, hazy pink 

smell: wheats, water, yeast, sugar, grenadine 

taste: sticky sweet like marsepain, bit of wheats , grenadine like ( cherry/framboise/strawberry ? ) taste ...

Pinkish hue color with a very small white airy head. Aroma is sweet, pure raspberry. Flavor is sweet like raspberry candy. Slightly beery flavored but mostly just sugary raspberry syrup with a light thin body. Really nothing offensive just a low rating because it is supposed to be beer.
Ottima bibita, ma non è una birra, troppo caramellosa e carbonata. Meglio l’originale
Nice easy drinker, soft mouthfeel slight tartness, Raspberry very evident on the aftertaste, enjoyable. Thanks to Fata for the brew!
Fata hooks it up. Keith is the man!! Red pour with a very light pink head. Sweet raspberry aroma. Flavor is sweet and creamy with loads of raspberries lightly tart and creamy.

I like fruit beers so I am not predisposed against this.  We tend to criticize beers from macro brewers such as this but on its merits it is a pretty drinkable fruit beer.  Not overly sweet, and indeed, a touch of sour balances that off.  The fruit is not overly exciting, but by the same token it isn’t cloying or artificial either.  So it makes for a fairly drinkable, if not exceptionally interesting fruit beer. Bottle in Den Haag.

Apricot purée color. No head. Aroma of wet wheat, raspberry funk and cereal. Flavor of artificial raspberry extract, heavy sugar, honey and wheat. Almost seems like a sweetener was added. Damaging. . Slick and viscous mouthfeel that is a touch unsatisfactory.
Pink colored brew. Aroma is awful, artificial aroma of berries, grain. Flavor is awful too, artificial berry syrup with nasty tones of cardboard and chemical waste. Drainpour.
Bottle from Cavie.  Sickly pink pour with a white head.  Aroma is grapefruit, tomato, rotten fruit, and salt.  Taste is raspberry, more fruit past its prime, Sweet n Lo, Equal, and Splenda.
My wife loved this beer but it was way to sweet for me.  It poured a good color and had a good aroma but just not for me
Bottle courtesy of fata2683. Murky reddish pink color. Smells of raspberries and dry tea leaves. Flavor of fake sweetness and saccharine. Lots of fruit flavors going on here.
Pours reddish amber with a pinkish head. Aroma is sweet caramel and rasperries. Flavour is light malt, heavy raspberries. Well balanced.

Bottle shared by keith, thanks man.  Pours a hazy orange body with a light pink head.  Cheers, wheat with a strong sweetness.  Grainy, hay, again a sweet cherry tone, almost grenadine in the flavor not in the viscosity.  An average fruit beer.
Sampled at RBWG 2010 courtesy fata (gee thanks).  Whoa this is a sweet and sticky bomb! Some raspberry and grain in there but it’s mainly just sweet.
Light pink pour with white head and lace. Deep berry cherry aroma. Sweet berry flavor with a flat finishing taste. A really thin beer.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours a clear and reddish/amber beer with an almost pink head. The aroma is raspberry. The flavor is raspberry, malt and some caramel. The palete is sweet and fresh. Overall a good and refreshing beer.

... The easiest beer to rate.
It’s basically tastes like raspberry juice with some hay, banana and spruce notes, that are very well hidden.
For what it is, it’s great. This said, at 8$/bottle at l’Autre Oeil, it’s kindof aimless. But hey, that’s something for the non-beer drinking lad (...hum... pepole) to drink, I guess.  The small bottle gives further clue towards this. Still, for what it is, it’s a success. The rating might seems a little high, but I have a weak spot for raspberries.
(25cl bottle)  Pours a hazy ruby body with a pinkish off-white head.  Aroma of raspberry, cardboard, and grain.  Flavor of raspberry syrup, wheat, and Clearly Canadian.
RBWG 2010. Pours hazy orangish color with white head. Aroma is all raspberry. Sweet raspberry flavor. Light to medium body with average carbonation.
RBWG@RLRL-thanks to -11.2oz bottle-pours a white ring for a head and cloudy orange color.  Aroma is raspberry, medium malt.  Taste is raspberry, medium malt.  Smooth, soft carbonation.

330mL. Now I would normally give this beer a 5 just to piss Urbain off- our little inside joke. Really- it’s not offensive. It’s just not really beer. It pours neon fake cloudy pink with a fairly large bright pink head that disappears fairly quickly. No lace. Aroma is tart raspberry, raspberry soda. Taste is raspberry soda with watered down witbier in the background. Would be awesome as a bisexual’s lawn mowing beer.
Tart raspberry on the nose.  Pours an orange pinkish color with a thick white head.  Citrusy with raspberry, light easy drinking, a little too artificial tasting.
smells like candy!  beautiful pink rose color. very sweet tangy taste with a bit of champaigne maybe.  wonderful feel.

Provdatum: 2009-06-13, 8 grader, burk
UTS: molnig blod grape, lätt flyktigt skum, frukt partiklar i jucien
D: jäst, frukt syrliga hallon
S: fräsch Hoegaarden sälta, vete, rårörd skogs hallon saft, grape
ES: vete, hallon
Trodde aldrig att jag skulle sätta en burköl som en 5:a, grymt (kanske inte platsar i de fina salongerna)

Bottle. Very pink color, little head, and disappears quick. Aroma’s doesn’t seems to be natural, very weird. Taste the same, it taste like there is something chemical inside. Drinkable, but that’s it.
Can: Strong fresh aroma, very refreshing well balanced fuit beer. Food Pairing: Rasberry Cheesecake.
Almost pink ale with fruity freshnesh, raspberries, and some acidity. Somewhat artificial fruitflavour though. Drinks well.
sweet aroma,red, clear, rocky head, medium sweetness, light body, thin feel, lively, it is a lady beer
Pink and a bit unclear. Has a light red head, fully lasting. Aroma: Sweet fruit, mostly fruit-syrup, bit artificial. Flavor is heavy sweet.

This is what we refer to as a "Dirty hoe" in the states; 3 parts Hoegaarden, 1 part framboise.  Smells raspberry juicy, frambiose-like.  A hazy, chalky pink (probably artificially so)  with a small white head.  Like a raspberry spritzer in taste.  Not very beer-like but enjoyable.

Medium shiny light pink head. Muddy pale purple body. Mealy papery aroma with faint raspberry traces. Sweet papery raspberry taste with wheaty citric notes. Mid-to-full body. Mild, rounded mouthfeel. Dry wheaty citric raspberry aftertaste, faintly artificial. Decent, but far from great. Too sweet. (0.25l can, Systembolaget, Charlottenberg.)

Found one in the fridge, usually my girlfriend drinks this. Looks pinkish and cloudy red. Head is pinkish white and dissipates quickly. Aroma is of raspberry, raspberry and even more raspberry. Smells quite good although quite artificial. Flavour is also completely dominated by very sweet raspberry. As with diet soda, I also immediately encounter some artificial sweetner added. Although the raspberry does not taste bad, the sweetner dominates the finish and actually ruins the whole experience. Would have actually liked it otherwise.
21st February 2008. Tepid slightly sweet raspberry. Okay but just uninspiring.

Dark pink color with reddish hues, quite cloudy. The head is about 2 cm and has a light pink color. It settles fast and leaves small lacings. Of course, this looks kind of weird judged as a witbier, but it’s actually quite good looking and since it’s brewed with fruit juice, I assume that the pink color is ok.

A weak smell, completely dominated by candy-like raspberry aromas. Faint notes of wheat, yeast and vanilla sugar. A boring smell, not very pleasant.

The taste is actually just bad. It’s weak and one-sided. It’s very very sweet, and I mean like sugar, with almost nothing else than cloying candy-like artificial raspberry flavors. No tartness what so ever that could balance the sweetness. Some notes of banana, wheat, faint spices, yeast and perhaps some malts. The finish is short and just has some faint notes of raspberries to it.

The mouthfeel is actually the worst part of this beer. It’s sticky and it clings onto the mouth in a very unpleasant manner. After a while, it gets really disturbing. Medium body, low levels of carbonation.

This is simply just a really bad beer. I had trouble finishing a glass of it, and I can’t come up with a single reason to drink it again. Not recommended.

Serving type: bottle

(Copy of old Beer Advocate review)

Bottle, 3 % ABV (i.s.o. the 4,5 of this page). Big foamy head, not dense at all. Rose red coloured, armoa is a bit of cherries, not too much aroma. Taste is light , fruity (cherries, strawberry). Sweet, light. Drinking cassis is nicer.

Draught @ BH, Pori. Murky tomato juice, light pink firm head, Strange, very artificial  aroma with sweeteners, raspberry candies, C-vitamin drink-mix, not too sweet actually, but there’s loads of minerals. Flavor is table sugar and that same raspberry additive, not much else. Very mellow soft carbonation. Candy beers can be drinkable, but this one surely wasn’t.

Bottle. The aroma is a little bit malty and sour. The white head is rather small and not long staying. The body is dark orange. The taste is very sweet, like fruit syrup. The finish is even sweeter. The body is rather light with a soft carbonation and dry-creamy. The beer is way to sweet, nearly sticky in the mouth

Can bought at Systembolaget.

Hazy pink, fluffy large head.

Sweet aroma with a lot of raspberry. To sweet flavor and artificial. Not my kind of beer.

Can from Systembolaget.
Cloudy pink, large firm head. Lovely raspberry aroma.
Very sweet, the fine fruit flavour does not balance the overload of artificial sweetener!

Pours a hazy red pink color with a light pink head that did not stay long.  Aroma of sweet fruits.  Flavors are very sweet, too much, with some rasberry sirup.  With just a hint of beer here, more like a fruity soda. Too sweet and just drinkable.
The bottle looks simple - really like a cheap beer. Starts very sweet, modest fruity like berries. In the background a dry and spicy note. Finish again sweet. Better than exspected.

0.25 L can from Systembolaget. A pink-shaded blond head upon an unclear, orangey-red body. Candy-ish raspberry aroma with a noticeable tartness. Taste is rather sweet, citrussy and berry-ish, balanced by some acidity. A hint of wheaty malts and almonds. Light body, sparkling mouthfeel. A pretty nice fruit beer, clean and refreshing.
At an dekamarkt supermarkt in zaandam, can 250ml, pink, very thin head, red fruits like made with factory acid, its not a brew,.
Bottled. The aroma was perfumed with red fruitiness. Clear, pink-red coloured beer with a white head. The taste is sweetish with citrus and raspberry. Artificial and cheap.
Can  25cl: . Hazy red colour, with a thin red/white head. Aroma of citrus,rasperry,  and yeasty. Flavor is raspery cider mouth feeling.Thin  body and a short to medium rasperry finish

250 ml can. Reddish cloudy golden colour. Medium-sized white fine-laced head that clings to the glass. Sweetish fruity aroma. Wheaty. Quite mellow. Nice balance between the fruit and the wheat malts. A little too sweet in my opinion. Less artificial than I had expected. In fact I don’t find it particularly artifical at all. The raspberry feels quite natural, as it is quite similar to the home beers using real raspberries. Works nicely as a thirst quencher on a hot summer day.
Pinkish. Lots of rasberries. Otherwise kind of like a traditional Hoegaarboiled den. Weath, coreander and &#40yes&#41 a tad of boiled ham. Kind of liked it.

Canned: Colour is orange/pink. The fluffy head looks good, but doesn’t last long. Wheaty aroma that has notes of jelly beans. Fizzy mouth feel. Flavour is sweet and wheaty with artificial  notes of sourish raspberries.

When I was a kid I got this thick, pink medicine and it tasted pretty much like this smells. The aroma? Yeast, raspberry, fizzy candy and vomit.

Tastes like watered down Hoegaarden with added fruit syrups. I’m going to find that Swedish wine press blogger who recommended this and punch him in the gonads.

Bottled from AH in Mestreech. Color is pinkish something, with pinkish off-white foamy head. Nose is sour and sweet framboise. Aroma has supressed wheatbeer and dominating framboise and berries. Flavour is the same and it leaves a sweetish muthfeel. Not a bad one in its class but not again.

25cl bottle. Pours a hazy red colour with a pink small head. Aroma is berries, obviously. Flavor is berries again, in particular raspberries and strawberries. Thin body, medium-high carbonation. No bitterness. Too sweet.

Afwul. I love raspberries but this tastes like pure syrup. Way too sweet and nothing like beer anymore. I love experimenting, but this concoction makes three week old milk with green spots taste like a delicacy.
Can. Pours hazy pink/red.. Head is pink. Aroma is sweet. Dominates from rasberries. Flavor is very sweet from rasberries. Palate is medium. This is more like a cider...

Aroma of raspberries, yeast and chemicals. A quite nice red apperance. The taste is awful, sweet and stifling with a hint of raspberries. This taste really bad! The only beer I can recall that’s worse is Floris Frais!

Can 25 cl. Hazy pink/red color with a small foamy pink head. Sweet aroma with lots of raspberries, some citrus and yeast. Flavor is sweet with raspberries and yeast.  A watery and artificial experience, not really as fun as i thought.

It poured a hazy orange-red liquid with a small white foam that left some lacing. The colour actually appealed to me and could have been a nice lambic. However the can is a big minus.

The aroma was sweet and also had some sourness. It also had a strong fruity scent where rasberries where very dominant but also some strawberries. I also got a scent of milk, but might be some kind of bacteria.

It tasted sweet and artificial like a soda. The fruitiness was there just as in the smell, lots of rasberries and some strawberries. The taste dissapeared very fast and made it feel watery and bland. 

The beer wasn’t unpleasent but it also wasn’t very good.
Can. Orange/pink colour with a pink/white head. Artificial sweetness, raspberries, rose hip soup, maybe some faint hints of spices and wheat in the background. Too sweet and unbalanced.

Can@home

Apperance: Pinkish color with some head and a little lacing.

Aroma: Raspberries, Belgian yeast, Dishwater, Sugar.

Flavor: Raspberries, Sugar, Belgian yeast, Bread, Fruit.

Palate: Sticky sweet and feels very artificial. Liquid candy in a bad way.

Hell no. This is just god awful. The normal hoegaarden is miles better than this attempt at a beer-alcopop-thingy.

250ml can
Pours unclear and candy pink. 
Smells of raspberry pie and candy.
Sweet taste of raspberry candy and not like a "real" fruit beer, not bad but not realy a beer either...

Slightly hazy orange/pink with a small white head. Strong aroma of raspberry winegum. Sweet and sugary raspberry flavour, with some malt notes. Can’t really hate it, but it does have an artificial feel.
This is not beer. It has no body and no real flavors. Super sweet chemical raspberry junk. Kind of refreshing though...

bottle, small but surprising stable head, orange/red colour. This is a better ’rape version’ of the hoegaarden. Intense but good raspberry smell. The beer has ’some bitterness’ but is too sweet as well. Raspberry and sugar.I really can’t recognize any other taste.

Can, 25cl - Hazy pink orange beer with a small head. Aroma is sweet with strong notes of raspberries, vanilla and citrus. Flavor is dominated by notes of raspberries with hints of citrus and wheat. Pretty nice and surprising, but perhaps a bit too much.

Can in Malmö.
Clear red coloured with a medium sized white head.
Sweet aroma of malts, wheat, corn, berries and citrus.
Very sweet flavour of malts, corn and raspberries.
Watery.

It pours a hazy, cloudy pink with virtually no foam. Aroma is plainly raw raspberrys, but the classic witbier smell of clove and yeast can be discerned in the background. Taste is same as the aroma. A bit too sweet, and without any sourness or bitterness to balance it up. The sweet taste ends unexpectedly and abrupt - almost no aftertaste at all. I’d rather have a framboise lambic than this one.
HBF09 rose color with a white head. pink flowery aroma and flavor with too much sweetness: very faggot. Could not finish a bottle.

25 cl bottle. Hazy rose color with a sturdy white head. Neutral fresh raspberry aroma. Not syrupy, but sweet. Raspberry flavor. A bit of seed bitter comes forth after awhile, so it heads towards balanced. Doesn’t quite get there. Interesting fruit beer though.

Draught (330 ml) at William K, Helsinki, Finland. 
Dark ruby red colour.
Tart raspberry aroma. Sweet, very sweet, raspberry, floury, wheatish, but after all extremely sweet. Too sweet for me I’m afraid.

Blood grapefruit colour! Orange-red shading to yellow. White head. Strong tart raspberry aroma, very fresh. Unfortunately it tastes suspiciously of acesulfan k and aspartam and is way too sweet for me. Seriously nasty if you thing about it.

Keg (Hilpea Hauki, Helsinki)

Tart raspberry aroma. Thick turbid pink, persistent head. Very sweet fruity taste - raspberries aplenty. Light wheaty base, and pleasant fruity hops. A touch of perfumed soap, but not so it detracts from the flavour. Too sweet, but very very easy drinker.
.25ml bottle, pours a nice pinkish color with a small white head.  Very sweet beer, raspberry, rose petals and a hint of lemon.  Definitely not the best fruit beer I’ve had, but it’s decent.

Can  Hazy, pink-red-orange fluo body.  White head with hints of the same colour as the body.  Sweet aroma of raspberries, peach, carbondioxide, yeast, wheat.  Heavily (cloyingly) sweet, lightly bitter flavour.  Artificial flavour - soft drink/alcohol pop like.  Unbalanced flavour, the little bit bitterness doens’t add up in a good way to the balance.

Bottle. It pours a fine, hazy orange body with a golden hue. Finger-thick pinkish white head. Very sweetish and artificial on the nose, just like raspberry candy. In the far back there’s a grainy touch and a faint note of citrus. Effervescent on the palate, medium full, and almost sticky. Sweet, candy-ish flavor with lots of artificial-like raspberry, as well as white sugar and some bitterness. Sweet, herbal-bitter finish with the sweetness dominating. With a lower sugar saturation it would be refreshing in the spring sun, but this gets sticky like kids candy, and tastes much the same. At least it’s not bad and full of flaws. (090321)

This is quite an experience...

The aroma is light raspberry and wheat with some phenoic notes. The flavour is sweet with loads of raspberry, castersugar and some wheat. Initially I was about to puke, but somehow it grew on me. Really odd....
25cl, from Geers Oostakker, not complex sweet fruit brew, yet easy to drink, not balanced, cloudy, small head, nothing special

No 691

Rated: 16.02.2009

Bottle brown, 250 ml

Appearance: Pours strawberry, rosy red, very lively and quite beautiful, rarely found colour of beer, saturation is quite high and vivid, head is initially medium, slowly decreasing to small, frothy in texture, compact, off white, with slightly reddish hue.

Aroma: Natural raspberry juice aroma, some wheat at the background, yeasts, very mild, milky, mellow, fresh grains,whipped cream, some notes of malted barley laying at the background, banana, colve, flowery, mild, fresh hoppyness, note of spices.

Flavour: Very nicely balanced flavour, natural raspberry juice, wheat, barley, flowery refreshing hops, spices, creamy texture, very smooth, easy going, gentle alcoholic note, gentle sweetness at the front, later on yeastyness, aromatic flowery - hoppy nose, wheat and spices giving nice peppery impression on tongue, finish duration is moderate to long.

Palate: Body is medium, texture is smooth, slightly syrupy, carbonation on palate is mild, finish feel is gently alcoholic with fruity and flowery aromas.

250 ml can, thanks to tarjei. ABV is 4.5%. Cloudy pink colour, big to moderate head with a pinkish hue. Strong sweetish aroma of ripe raspberries / raspberry jam. The flavour is sugary sweet with loads of ripe raspberries. Oh dear. Well, at least it is not as horrible as Hoegaarden Citron. I was able to finish this one.

appears cloudy pink with a white thick head. aroma of fresh raspberries dominates, also a bit like a  fresh rose wine.
flavor is raspberries, faint beer flavor too, slight beer bitterness in the end. good raspberries though. fresh and non-artificial.
Fine little fruit beer. Red color with a pinkish head. Aroma of rasberry and wheat. Sweet fruity rasberry suger flavor with some wheat notes. Easy going and refreshing.
Bottle. Red-orange colour with a pink to white head. Aroma is raspberrry, yeast, malt. Flavour is the same. Medium mouthful.

Bottle. 3.0%. No ’best before’ date. Pours a pinkish, dark amber, with a pinkish head. Good lacing. Sweetish, and a bit tart, raspberry aroma. Remote hint of cardboard. Flavour is raspberry, a bit sugary, on a somewhat malty background. A bit dry, dusty as well, and with a remote hint of cardboard. Same finish, a wee bit tart, mildly bitter. Overall good; all about the raspberries, easy to drink, somewhat candy-like. 18.05.19.

Old rating: 6 / 3 / 6 / 3 / 11 = 2.9
Bottle. 27 days past ‘best before’. Pours a hazy, pinkish amber wit ha small light pink head. Sweet, raspberry aroma with some malt hiding behind it. Flavour is raspberries with notes of perfume and remote milk notes. Mildly bitter raspberry finish with lingering perfume notes. A tad dry. Okay, as I like raspberries a lot, but not very beer-like. 22-11-08.

Pours a dark cloudy maroon/ pinkish-red with a pink bubbly head.  Arom consists of sour cherries.  Smells kind of like a ludens cough drop.  Flavor is a balance of sweet fruit and sour lambic if you could call it that.

Bottle 25cl.
Pours a clear pink colour with a small head and loads of carbonation.
Smell is very and distinctive raspberrys.
Taste is also very sweet and obviously has only raspberrys there.
Bottle.  Cloudy orange and pink with an off-white head.  Aromas are sweet wheat and artificial raspberry.  Flavours are sweet and artificial raspberry.  Strawberry cream sweets.  Not for me.

The color is orange-golden and the head is slightly pink, creamy and lasting. The aroma has notes of sweet raspberries and so does the flavour. It’s mostly sweet, but it does have a little berry acidity. In the long run the sweetness is too strong.

Pinky beer with a minimal head. In the aroma dominates the raspberry, some banana and wheat-beer aroma from the origin...In the flavor you can feel the raspberry-syrup what was added to the witbier...Mass producted beer to the market...

July 2008. Bottled. 
Pink colour with low head. Sweet and fruity raspberry aroma, bit artificial. Sticky sweet in flavour, with sugary feel to it.
Bottle. Color is hazy amber/orange/red. Aroma and taste are mild and sweet. Malt and fruit. Good and refreshing on a hot summer day.
Bottle@Home. Fruity aroma. Cloudy, red, pinkish head, fair lace. Very sweet, artificial fruits and uh, that’s it. Sugar water mouthfeel. Yuck!

Bottled.
Pinkish with a small head.
Sweet aroma with loads of raspeberries.
No bitterness but sugary sweet.
250ml Bottle - Pinky red in colour. Sweet and lightly tart aroma. Sweet and sugary raspberry taste though not overwhelmingly so. Refreshing but not serious enough.

Canned(250ml). -on some gas station near Antwerpen.

Artificial pale pink coloured, huge pinkish head, intensive sweet raspberry nose. Sweet faint fruity and raspberry juice taste with weak wheaty notes. Short finish and a way too sweet.
Bottle, mid-red with a nice pink head. Nose is raspberry. Mouth is very sweet, raspberry, some wheat underlying. Too sweet and dominating.
My wife swears by this stuff, but it’s too sweet for my taste.  The rasberry is refreshing but too dominating.
Bottle. Ruby with pink head. Fresh raspberry aroma, maybe a bit too sweet but I prefer this before  Mort Subite Xtreme Framboise.
Red orange colored with hazy appearance. Little pink head. Nothing but artificial raspberries in aroma. Flavor is even sweeter with same raspberry dominating, hard to rate.
Bottle. thanks rickgordon. Very pronounced aroma of raspberries with a hint of creamy wheat in the background. Very sweet taste. Almost candylike. Reminding of vanilla icecream with rasperries on.
Bottle.  Lightly muddy looking reddish beer with a strongish head.  The aroma is lightly fruity, and the flavour is soapy and fruity.  Overall a poorish beer.
Bottle (33 cl), thanks rickgordon. Nice ruby colour, pinkish white head. Fresh raspberry aroma, moussy mouthfeel, a bit too sweet. Overall, quite good.

it has a nice smell, I’m not sure if this is kind of smell that a beer has to have but is not disgunsting, appearance looks more like a fruit juice, not and the foam disappears quickly. taste is good, nice combination of strawberries, citrus and notes of bitterness, the combination of sweetness and bitterness is ok,
[Bottle from La Roche.] Funny beer which at the same time is citrusy and too sweet. Is good in the heat.
Bottle. Pours dusty orange/red with a pink head. Aroma of sweet raspberries. Flavour is raspberries and wheat. Way to sweet for me even served ice cold.
bottle. very fruity aroma. small head. different then the other rosée beers i’ve tasted. less sweeter taste. not bad but on a hot summer day, I prefer the hoegaarden witbier.
25 cl can, bought in shop in Oostende. Hazy orange color, nice whitw/off-white head. Aroma is fruit and berries. Flavor is berries all the way. Quite thin beer - but refreshing.
bottle, cherry sweet tart, reddish yellow color, very refreshing rasberry soda flavors and body, not bad

Bottle. Thanks to my girlfriend, who’s really into this stuff. I’m not too fond of these fashionbeers, but this one sticks out. Smells of raspberries and a whole lot of sweetness. The flavour is not too sweet for the style, has a little sourness and some freshness to it. Very popular among Dutch girls, they actually think it’s beer mixed with rosé wine.

Bottle. Orangered with huge pale pink head. Aroma with lots of raspberries and some wheat notes. Taste very sweet with raspberries and wheat in the background. Raspberries in the finish. A fruit beer that could be used as an aperitif or following an icedesert.
Hazy pinkish coloured beer with small white head. Sweety fruity aroma. Palate is sweet and creamy. Finish is fruity and a bit dry.

Thanks a lot to xnoxhatex for sharing this one. The body was a hazy orange red, kind of like a lighter tequila sunrise, with a white head. The aroma was obvious raspberries with some light sugar cookie notes. The taste was sweet cake donuts with some raspberries behind that. Very sweet.

25cl bottle from random beer store in Belgium.  Cloudy red/orange/amber with small, long lasting white head with pink tint.  Aroma is sweet raspberry with subtle wheat note dryness.  Cloying sweet with raspberries, a little like cool aid.  Light beer with nice carbonation.  Way too sweet, but I’m glad I’ve tried it.

Bottled. A dark golden - pinkish beer with a huge pinkisth head. The aroma is sweet with lovely notes of raspberries - in a very refreshing way. The flavor is sweet with strong notes of raspberries, with a light underlying note of malt, leading to a slightly bitter finish. I could use more acidity - but otherwise a nice beer for a hot summerday.
Pours a hazy raspberry colour with no head. Raspberry aroma. Very strange flavour, with little discernible raspberry and some weird herbal aftertaste.
Bottled.  Cloudy dark pink, small head. Aroma of ripe raspberries. Light and fresh up front with vanilla and wheat. Sadly it turns into cloying lemonade in the finish.

Bottle from local store. Cloudy white with a pinkish glow, thick pinkish head. Obvious combination of the standard Hoegaarden white, combined with raspberry juice, which makes it very sweet and (artificial) fruity.

I would say this beer is a failed attempt of Hoegaarden at mixing the wit bier and the taste of grapefruit. I would recommend the Pink Killer of Brasserie de Silly instead.

Drank it last summer in Belgium. Beer was available in packs of 6 at most stores.

Mix of wit bier and Rosé (grapefruity). A little fruity but still with the Hoegaarden signature white.
After trying the Pink Killer, this Hoegaarden would not do it for me. It lacked much of the flavor that I was looking for.
Serving type: Hoegaarden glass.

Bottle. Creamy pink excellent mostly lasting head. Red colour. Powerful raspberry aroma and flavor. Moderate sweet. Average finish. Syruply palate. One can I say? I like raspberry so this is excellent stuff.

Bottle. Poured a hazy rose color and small pink head. Aroma is like a butter biscuit and jam. Nothing complex here, but tasty and light bodied with a really spritzy mouthfeel. Refreshing and well made.
300 ml bottle. hazy pinkish colour, small head.  moderate fruity taste. almost no alcohol taste.

Bottle at De Kleine Post.
Hazy, rose/orange with a white head, fine lacings. Aroma moderate malty (raspberries). Flavor moderate sweet. Light body.
Bottle. Hazy pinkish colour with a medium white head. Fruity raspberry aroma and taste with herbal notes. Nice refreshing beer.

Bottled 25cl (BB 01/2009)

Hazy pinky red color, small pinky-white head. Fruity almost fresh rasberry aroma with notes of grain and sour milk. Sweet and sugary, rasberry juice concentrate flavor. Fizzy. Light tartness (mixed with sugar) in the finish. Artifical flavor in the aftertaste. So this is when you mix Hoegaarden, sugar and partly artifical rasberry?

(25 cl bottle purchased at a store in Neerpelt, Belgium) BB 25/11/08Shady apricot to pink color, pinkish laasting head. First impression is fresh sun-ripe raspberry scent, rather lovely. Though the second and following sniffs reveal a lactic sub-tone and artificial fruitiness. Very sweet raspberry and lactic taste, a bit metallic as well. A stale malty aftertaste lingers. A bit spritzy mouthfeel. Low bitterness. Could work well as a summer drink.

Bottle at Universitetsbaren Århus. Cloudy reddish colour with a pink/white head. Aroma and taste of raspberry, coriander and wheat. Very fresh and sour-sweet. Usually I don´t like lambic but this fruit beer, being very drinkable.
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy pinkish color with a small white head. Sweet fruity raspberry aroma. Sweetish raspberry flavor, slightly sugary too. Sweetish wheaty raspberry finish.

Bruxelles airport 170308
Bottled
Sweet and with a dominating rasberry aroma and flavor
Hazy pink colour, off-white head. Aroma has raspberry and sugar. Flavour is more beer-like than the wittekerke version. A bit better, not as sweet.

30cl bottle. Cloudy ruby pink colour with a pink head, quite pretty looking; slightly sour, intense raspberry aroma;lively in the mouth, fizzing on the tongue, with a fruity raspberry jam body; then a sweet finish. Very nice, but I’d have preferred a sourer ending.

bottle. An off-pink, and cloudy in color. Aroma is light bread, fruits (of course). Flavor tastes just like V8 Fusion. Raspberries, cherry, a bit of sour green apple. Its really a pretty tasty fruit beer. The mouthfeel is light bodied. I dont think i could handle this if it were any thicker though. I enjoy fruity little beers like this on occasion. I just dont think I’ll remember it.

Bottle.   Musty-sour raspberry aroma.  Cloudy red-orange color with small head.   Sweet-sour raspberry flavor - light mustiness.  An apparent attempt to get in on the sweetened fruit lambic scene - very similar to Lindemans, Belle-Vue, and Mort Subite’s Frambroise.

Great pinkish-reddish coloured body with a frothy white head. Aroma of rapberries, coriander seed and fresh wheat. Light-bodied; Sweet taste of candy sugar and raspberries up front with a good malt backbone and a light amount of hops also noticeable. Aftertaste is really sweet, but not overly so - a good bit of lemons keep things in check. Overall, a very nice beer (I can’t believe I’m saying that) and a good one to sample if you can find it! I sampled this 25 cL bottle purchased from a small corner store in Bruxelles, Belgium on 01-January-2008.
Hazy pink with tiny head. Strong raspberry notes in the very sweet aroma. Sweet sweet flavor dominated by raspberries. Wow that was sweet boring stuff...
Tasted in Hoegaarden. Thin body, pink/orange color, hazy. Sweet artificial taste of raspberry. Aprubt finish. Really uninteresting. Why is Hoegaarden making this beer?

from belgianshop.com; a raspberry witbier - reddish-orange colour with an irregular pinkish foam; strong sweetish raspberry nose with notes of straw in the background; very sweet with an illusion of sourness; a raspberryish and rather empty finish - not a tragedy but not a reason to finish my glass either

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a cloudy pink with a pinky white head and an unpleasant aroma of citrus and spice. Taste is dominated by raspberries and sweeteners, to the level where you can’t taste any beer at all in this. No malts, no hops, just cranberry-juice and sweetener, not my thing

Bottled. Pinkish red colour, mediumsized creamy white head. Aroma is mild wheat and a mix of raspberries & strawberries. Flavour is quite much the same. Kind of sweet meets sour. Yet it has some rubbery notes also.

Cloudy pink colour with thick foamy head. Aroma is sweet and fruity. Flavour is also sweet but in a fruity, not sugary way. The raspberry flavour is believable. It’s fairly fresh in the mouth with a slightly sour kick at the end.
Nada mais do que a witbier Hoegaarden "normal" com um adicional gosto de framboesa inserido, o qual, em alguns momentos, lembrou acerola. Nada mais. Não impressiona.
Muddy pale reddish colour with a small pinkish head. Sweet raspberry fruity aroma and taste. Fizzy, light dry and sweet finish.
Bottle. Pours a pink colour with a short pinkish fizzy head. Sweet raspberry aroma, which also appears in the flavour with more sweetness and raspberry.

Garrafa. É uma Witbier de framboesa, segundo a garrafa. Coloração laranja/rosa (lembrando suco de acerola), turva, com creme branco denso, mas sem volume. Gostosa! Consistência cremosa. Não senti características de cerveja. Carbonatação baixa.
Bottle. A pinkish beer with a big pink head. The aroma and taste is sweet raspberry. medium body with a sweet dry finish.

Bottle. Unclear light light red color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to pink head. Aroma is moderate raspberry, light malty, sweet, wheat. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. (031007)
Bottle, 4.5%. Cloudy, milky red colour. Small creamy pink head. Sweet raspberry aroma and flavour. Creamy mouthfeel. Not sickening, but a soft-drink-like beer.
As a fruit beer this is OK. Pink with a white head. rasberry all over. Like fruit juice. Soft & sweet with a minimal sourness & some sugar.  A bit synthetic - but tasted a lot worse.. Drinkable!

(Bottle 25 cl) Hazy, orangey red with a small, pinkish head. Very intense and somewhat tart raspberry aroma. Light-bodied, rather sweet raspberry notes with an underlying acidity and a somewhat soapy, astringent feel. 180907

From bottle at Brussels airport. The colour is a mix of yellow and pink, almost like a bloody orange. good white foam. Sweet raspberry sirup dominates the nose. The flavours show a little more sign of the refreshingly, somewhat acidic wheat beer, but raspberry and sugar are there in overdose. This beer is abusing the Hoegaarden name.

Bottle. [Courtesy of Papsoe, yet another great tasting @ Henrik´s] Average white/reddish glowing head that mostly lasted. Fair display of lacework. Hazy reddish color. Aroma of yeast that would be the famous Hoegaarden. Also notes of raspberries, wheat, citrus, perfume, maybe even a sniff of coriander. Light bodied with a soft carbonation. Flavor was of cause very sweet and fruity with a hint of acidic. Sweet and raspberries like finish. I actually liked the combination of the Hoegaarden aroma and the sweet fruit beer style. 18-09-2007
is that beer? Not that bad but honestly it tastes almost like soda. It’s an alright drink if you’re lookig for something sweet and refreshing but definitely not a "good beer".

Bottle at the Holiday Inn Express, Antwerp. Cloudy pink with a pinkish head to match. Sweet raspberry and hoegaarden, pretty much what it says on the tin but not in a good way. All round artificial tasting.

Bottle at the Holiday Inn Express, Antwerp.  Cloudy red/orange colour.  Sweet pippy raspberry.  Bit of tea on aroma.  Just a little too sweet in the mouth.  "that’s awesome," Mesandsim.  Way too sweet.  Artificial sweet fruit in mouth.

A Mes rate:
33cl bottle from our hotel bar in Antwerp. Funny how the day started with a 3 Fonteinen Millennium and finished up with this little beauty. Horribly cloudy off pink colour with a very chemical looking head. Very sweet raspberry aroma with some seriously rotten vegetation underneath. Flavour is farty, rancidly fruity and downright awful. Novelty toke for a finish to a great day.
colore rosato buona schiuma aroma non molto profumata sapore netto di lamponi un po artificiale dolce

25 cL bottle. Pours hazy red/orange with an off-white and light pink huge head. Sweet and citric aroma of raspberry, clean. Nice sweet raspberry flavour with a minor acidic twist towards the end. The finish is further strengthend by a caramel sugarish body. Quite clean and lacks some of the impurities that normally provides some edge but this works out nicely.

Bottle, bought at Havnens Vin og Tobak, Vejle. Pours a muddy pale pink with a big, staying creamy white-pink head. Leaves a good deal of lacing. Aroma is distinctly raspberries. Flavour is sweet, creamy and fruity. Not bad, just a good deal too sweet.
Bottle. High creamy lasting pink head. Hazy red body. Distinct raspberries aroma. Acidic raspberries falvor with a good deal of carbonatioh. Fresh and nich thirst killer. Long sweet aftertaste.
Bottle at home - shared with Mette & Jacob. Unclear red - white head. High raspberries, white sugar, wheat, high sweetness, light light bitterness.
